In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(words => ' ', text))
        if occursin(r"[^\s\d]", word)) || length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= " " * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return lines
end
```
Here's an example usage of the function:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Sed in ultrices massa. Nulla facilisi."""
result = wrap_string(text)

for (index, line) in enumerate(result)
    println("Line $(index+1}): $(line)")
end
```
This will output the text wrapped at the specified `text_width`.
